docs.snippet: Rather than being a singular phenomenon, Mr. Trump looks more like the political equivalent of a comet that crosses American presidential campaigns every few decades....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rather than being a singular phenomenon, Mr. Trump looks more like the political equivalent of a comet that crosses American presidential campaigns every few decades.
docs.abstract: Donald Trump's presidential campaign reflects patterns of historical political outsiders like Charles Lindbergh, William Randolph Hearst and Henry Ford, who appealed to voters who felt that they have been left out of mainstream politics.

headline.main: Donald Trump May Break the Mold, but He Fits a Pattern, Too
headline.print_headline: Trump May Break Mold, but He Fits a Pattern, Too

docs.snippet: Mr. Cruz refused to endorse his party’s nominee for president and was booed off stage as the Republican convention erupted in an uproar....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Cruz refused to endorse his party’s nominee for president and was booed off stage as the Republican convention erupted in an uproar.
docs.abstract: Sen Ted Cruz uses prime-time address at Republican National Convention to urge Republican voters to 'vote their conscience' and pointedly refuses to endorse Donald Trump; speech creates uproar at convention hall, with Cruz exiting stage to resounding boos from crowd.

headline.main: Ted Cruz Stirs Convention Fury in Pointed Snub of Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: Cruz Stirs Convention Fury in Pointed Snub of Trump

byline.contributor: Matt Flegenheimer, Michael D. Shear and Jeremy W. Peters contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal courts have reined in strict voter ID laws in Texas and Wisconsin, while a legal battle continues to rage over North Carolina's rules mandating showing identification at the polls — even after lawmakers there took pre-emptive steps to soften them.

docs.abstract: Profile of Indiana Gov Mike Pence, who has accepted Republican vice presidential nomination; Pence's conversion from Roman Catholic to evangelical Christian led him to become religious and social conservative and committed Republican.
